definition: to mess (sth) up/to foul up/to spoil
to do/to make/to go in for/to set up/to get hold of/to take care of
to smash/to pound/to fail/to muck up/to bungle

sentences.english: Julia is afraid she will embarrass herself and the whole team.
sentences.chinese: 茱丽雅害怕自己将舞蹈队带来麻烦甚至搞砸。

sentences.english: Like losing him is why this off-season is screwed up.
sentences.chinese: 好像失去他就是这个淡季搞砸了的原因了。

sentences.english: You screwed up, you didn't know whether to be more scared of the CO or John.
sentences.chinese: 当你搞砸了的时候，你不知道该更怕指挥官还是约翰。

sentences.english: This is your last chance to make the team, don't blow it.
sentences.chinese: 这是你最后一次机会进入球队，可别搞砸了。

sentences.english: Shoes also have the power to make an entire show go awry.
sentences.chinese: 鞋子也有把整台秀搞砸的能力。

sentences.english: You really fucked up this time.
sentences.chinese: 这回你可真他妈搞砸了。

sentences.english: I thought I could handle it myself. I didn’t know I would screw it up.
sentences.chinese: 原本我以为我可以自己处理的，没想到会把事情搞砸。

sentences.english: We say we want to besuccessful but we sabotage the job interview.
sentences.chinese: 我们说想要职业成功，却在求职面试时故意搞砸。

sentences.english: Our trip was spoilt by bad weather.
sentences.chinese: 我们的旅行被坏天气搞砸了。

sentences.english: And I'd say hey, man, you screwed up.
But I think very few people actually really mess up an interview.
sentences.chinese: 不过我觉得很少人能够真的搞砸一场面试。

sentences.english: So that I dont want to fuss… and fight no more.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我才不愿再去搞砸，不再为此而争吵了。

sentences.english: She was shouting, reminding him about every way she had been wronged and failed by him.
sentences.chinese: 她还是一直大嚷，提醒他每一件因他而搞砸的事情。

sentences.english: Hope it won't suck this time.
The hoarse tenor singer mucked up the recital.
sentences.chinese: 沙哑的男高音把音乐会搞砸了。
我搞砸了我的驾照考试。

definition: to go wrong/to take a wrong turning
to be defeated/to lose/to fail (e.g. experiments)/failure/defeat/CL:次[ci4]
to part on bad terms/(of a meeting etc) to break up in discord
to take a wrong turn/to go wrong
to go wrong/to get into trouble
to act impetuously (idiom); on an impulse
to dawdle/to go slow deliberately/to fizzle out/to have all one's hopes dashed/(Tw) to have a soak in a hot spring
lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful/to fail through lack of a final effort/to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
to overreach oneself/to try to be clever and end up with egg on one's face
